first_para: Chi Onwurah (born 12 April 1965) is a British Labour Party politician, who was elected at the 2010 general election as the Member of Parliament for Newcastle upon Tyne Central, replacing the previous Labour MP Jim Cousins, who decided to step down and left the seat. She is Newcastle's first black MP.

full.extract:
Chi Onwurah (born 12 April 1965) is a British Labour Party politician, who was elected at the 2010 general election as the Member of Parliament for Newcastle upon Tyne Central, replacing the previous Labour MP Jim Cousins, who decided to step down and left the seat. She is Newcastle's first black MP.
^ The London Gazette: no. 59418. p. 8738. 13 May 2010.
^ "Chi Onwurah". Democracy Live. 
^ "Election 2010: Results". The Guardian. Retrieved 7 May 2010. 
^ http://www.newstatesman.com/politics/2014/07/instead-getting-jackanory-i-got-trades-union-congress-chi-onwurah-mp
full.title: Chi Onwurah
